intro: Aydendron piauhyense, commonly known as the Piauhy palm, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Aydendron piauhyense is typically found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
